author: Staff Reporter
text:
Parents of students of the Stanes Anglo Indian Higher Secondary School staged a protest on the campus on Tuesday alleging discrimination by the school management.

Sources said that the the school management reportedly refused to include for excursion a few students who had not paid the amenities fees.

The parents contention was that they were ready to pay the amenities fees provided the Inspector of the Anglo Indian School fixed the fees.

The Inspector was supposed to have fixed the fees five months ago, as per a court order.

The parents alleged that the school management had promised to take students on excursion and asked students to get parents’ consent.

When the parents provided their consent, the management had said that the tour was open for only those students who had paid the amenities fees.

The school was supposed to take the students out on February 27 (Saturday).

When parents questioned the discrimination, the management had reportedly replied that the excursion fees fell under the ‘amenities fees’ head and that the tour was open for only those who had paid it.

This left the parents agitated. They then decided to take to the streets to protest but the management had prevented them from doing so.

Principal Dennis Chen said that the school had denied inclusion in the excursion for only those students, fewer than 200, who had not paid any fees since the start of the academic year.

Excursion was only an extra curricular activity and it had not direct relation to academics.
title: Parents stage protest
